definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
to cry out in alarm or surprise
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight

sentences.english: John has a windfall . It surprises his wife greatly .
sentences.chinese: 約翰意外獲得一筆財富，使他夫人大喫一驚。

sentences.english: No one in the bar appears surprised to see a disabled person dancing.
sentences.chinese: 看到希福跳舞，酒吧裏的人似乎一點都不喫驚。

sentences.english: At this point of time, Hanwen arrives to arrest Shouye.
sentences.chinese: 這時漢文與偉民前來拘捕守業，衆人喫驚。

sentences.english: Three surprising things came out of Starr’s testimony.
sentences.chinese: 斯塔爾的證詞中有三處令人喫驚。

sentences.english: A girl passed close to him, and Lieutenant Blandford started.
sentences.chinese: 一個女孩靠近他走過，布蘭佛德中尉喫驚地動了一下。

sentences.english: Then, to my sur-prise, he hugged me.
sentences.chinese: 然後，讓我喫驚的是，他擁抱了我。

sentences.english: I was frightened at the sound.
sentences.chinese: 我聽到那聲音不禁大喫一驚。

sentences.english: The appearance of the whale has stunned marine biologists.
sentences.chinese: 這頭灰鯨的讓海洋生物學家大爲喫驚。

sentences.english: It’s astonishing what great teachers can do for their students.
sentences.chinese: 優秀教師對自己學生所做的令人喫驚。

sentences.english: The next day morning, the professor would be surprised to open the door.
sentences.chinese: 次日一早，教授打開屋門便大喫一驚。

sentences.english: To their surprise, the so-called investor is a swindler.
sentences.chinese: 令他們喫驚的是，那個所謂的投資商是騙子。

sentences.english: The first thing that struck Georgiana when entering the laboratory was the hot furnace.
sentences.chinese: 走進實驗室後第一件讓她喫驚的事便是裏面的暖氣。

sentences.english: Night terrors are an inherited problem and occur in about 2% of children.
sentences.chinese: 夜驚是遺傳性的，約2%的孩子會有夜驚問題。

sentences.english: She was gobsmacked to find that the man in black coat was her classmate of primary school.
sentences.chinese: 她喫驚的發現那個穿黑外套的男人是她的小學同學。

sentences.english: And the "Scream" mask has become a classic Halloween costume.
sentences.chinese: “驚聲尖叫”面具也成爲經典萬聖節裝飾。

definition: dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises
a period of time/a while/for a short while/temporary/momentary/at the same time
